content:
What do folks think about Vlad Korobov 's send button proposal?

image.png

Specifically, a couple of points for feedback:

  1. Switching from the word Send to an icon.
  2. The choice to have the icon pointing up.

I personally like the switch to an icon, which seems like it requires less work to process than reading a word, and is quite standard.

The up-pointed icon looked weird to me when I first saw it, though I mostly stopped noticing it the 10th time I saw it.

I agree with the (1) point of switching send with the icon as it's much obvious now a days to understand the use-case of this Icon, but i don't like the (2) point of switching it with the up arrow icon -- (may be because i haven't seen this ever in any chat application or any sort of thing)
(The motivation for pointing up is that this is where the message goes, but pointing to the right seems more standard even if it's less logical.)
that up arrow appears to match the common symbolism for sending email in apps?
Yeah, i agree and understood the motivation behind it -- it seems completely logical with the up arrow -- but yeah it's not in the "standard"

Ken Clary said:

that up arrow appears to match the common symbolism for sending email in apps?

Really? I feel like I've never seen that before.
I agree with Alya that the standard thing seems to be to have a similar icon but pointing right. (Or right-and-slightly-up, sometimes.)
maybe it's a mobile gmail / ios mail thing? not sure, haven't checked recently, but I was not confused by it at all.
+1 to it being very reasonable to point up, but also would likely take up unnecessary head space in a new user's brain as they figure out how Zulip works (because pointing right is more common).
Here's the Material version, for example: image.png

Feather:

image.png

Chris Bobbe said:

Feather:

image.png

this looks better than the one which is completely straight upside.

I'm also used to seeing the rightwards pointing arrow in similar apps and think this isn't a place where being innovative is helpful. Personally, I'm not a fan of the feather icon, so would propose we just go with a classic right-facing arrow.

classic right-facing arrow

What is this classic? Material design icon? Are we going to follow that approach in mobile (arrow up currently)?

Not sure what you mean; the send button we have in mobile is a right-pointing arrow / paper-airplane.

In fact it looks like we use exactly the Material "send" icon.
Ok, lets use that one
@Greg Price you right about the icon... I confused Telegram and Zulip
Ah, I guess Telegram is an example of the "up and to the right" version of this icon concept: image.png
(in their logo, that is)
